Title: the occupation recalibration

Scene: The apartment. Penny and Sheldon are doing yoga.
Sheldon: It’s an outrage.
The university, they think they can do whatever they want. We just have to sit there and take it.
You work tirelessly for someone, and this is what you get.
But I don’t want a vacation.
Oh, this again? So, Penny proposed, you didn’t say yes, and now you think you may have lost her love forever. How does this compare to me being forced to relax for a few days?
Thank you.
I’m going to go inside, put on my coziest pajamas, curl up with a good book and wait for this nightmare to be over.
Come on, take me to work with you.
Please. What if there’s a big breakthrough in science today and I’m not there to see it?
No. I was just tricking you.
Leonard, wait. Take me with you.
Please.
Too bad. I’m coming with you.
But.
Hello.
I’m on vacation. What do you think?
Leonard told me to stay.
Where are you going?
Well, have fun.
Really?
Okay. I’m inside the CERN super collider.
Wow. Didn’t see that coming.
Let me guess.
What was I gonna do? Two ins in a row? Where’s my lemonade?
A fitting swan song to your career as a waitress, to forget my order one last time.
Do you see me drinking lemonade?
Why do you ask?
No, I don’t think you are.

The best way to achieve a goal is to devote 100% of your time and energy to it. When I decided I was going to be a physicist, I didn’t take some other job in case it didn’t work out. Which wasn’t easy because there was a lot of pressure from Ms. Pearson for me to be chalk monitor that year.
Because he’s not like us, Penny. We’re dreamers.
I’ve read that there are great yogis who have such mastery over their bodies they can draw water in through their genitals.
Too bad. It seems like a good way to drink a milk shake without getting brain freeze.
Well, to be honest, I thought she said Yoda.
Namaste.
I’m willing to if you guys are.

Y, No. I’m as much a part of this relationship as you two, and I think it’s high time we put all our cards on the table. For example, where is this going? Are you two ever getting married? And, if so, where will we all live? Have you thought about that?
Penny?
Good. Now we’re getting somewhere.
Yeah, no kidding. Despite what it says on her résumé, she is no longer 22.
He does that to me, too. Why do we put up with it?
I’m fine with it.
Well, to celebrate this reconciliation, let’s all share a milk shake. Uh, Penny, you’ll need a straw.
Leonard: I know.
You need to let it go, Sheldon.
Oh, my God, they’re just making you use your vacation days.
Okay, listen, I don’t mean to diminish what you’re going through, but I’m a little distracted right now.
It doesn’t.
I’m gonna go talk to Penny.
Hey.
Okay.
Look, if you want to break up, just say it.
No, no, no, no. I take it back. Don’t say it. Just, just hate me, but stay with me. It worked for my parents.
Oh. Oh, okay. Good, good. So, it’s cool if I cry a little?
Yeah.
Look, I get it, and I want you to know that I support whatever you want to do.
Wow. That, that’s a big step.
So, well, before making any rash…
And I support you.
No. You’re on vacation.
Do you really think there’s gonna be a breakthrough without you there to do it?
Bye.
No.
No.
Oh, Sheldon, stay.
I said stay. I’m going to work. Do not follow me.
Yeah.
I don’t know. She already thinks I don’t support this, so if I call, it might look like I’m checking up on her.
Of course I do. She’s a great actress. I’m proud she’s taking this risk.
You bought that? Great. I got to call her before I forget how I said it. Hey.
Oh, how’s it going? You taking Hollywood by storm?
You got your job back. That is great news. I didn’t want to say anything, but you are making the right choice. To plunge yourself into debt right now would be literally insane.
And I support you.
Oh, hey.
How did she get you to do yoga?
Oh, how many times do I have to say it? I support you.
Fine. I’m not sure you should have quit. But if you care so much what I think, why didn’t you ask me before you did it?
Yes. I thought we were in the kind of relationship where we make decisions together. If I’m wrong, then maybe we need to talk about the kind of relationship we’re actually in.
Can we please have some privacy?
No.
For some reason, we’re planning a future where we both live with Sheldon forever.
I swear, I am on your side.
Listen, I could never do what you’re doing, okay? I would be terrified.
My point is, just because I couldn’t do it doesn’t mean you shouldn’t. And I’m proud of you.
Penny: Hi.
Look, I’m sorry I didn’t text you back. I just needed some time to think.
Yeah. Come in.
Leonard…
Listen, I don’t want to break up with you.
Yeah, I probably wouldn’t.
Look, you did the right thing last night. I was a mess. I was just frustrated because my career is going nowhere.
Great, because I’ve been thinking, if I really want this acting thing to work, I need to focus all my energy on it. And to do that, I should quit waitressing at The Cheesecake Factory.
I know.
I already quit.
Oh. Hey, Sheldon.
You okay?
Why are you sitting in the stairwell?
Oh. Well, good boy.
Oh, I have a ton of errands to run. I need to make copies of my headshot, send them off to agents and sign up for a new acting class.
Okay. You want to come with me?
Come on, boy. Come on. Let’s go. Let’s go. Get in the car. Come on.
Hi. What’s up?
Actually, I’m at The Cheesecake Factory.
Yeah. I’m just returning my uniform.
I didn’t get it.
Do you think quitting my job was a mistake?
No. I’m serious.
Because Leonard just pissed me off. Am I being an idiot or not?
Really?
Thank you. I needed to hear that. Why can’t Leonard understand it?
Yeah, I need to start cracking the window when I leave you in the car.
And hold three, two, one. Very good. Now let’s try Warrior 2. And hold.
Yeah, well, I don’t think we’re gonna get to do that today.
And now we go to Reverse Warrior.
I’m helping him relax because, unlike you, he supports me.
Sheldon, take a break.
Okay, if you support me, what was with that phone call?
Oh, so now I need your permission? Would you have asked me before you quit your job?
Yeah, well, maybe we do.
Okay, wait. What are we doing?
Look, I know you think I’m being reckless, and you might be right, but I need to take this shot.
You keep saying you’re on my side, but you don’t act like it.
Well, it’s scary for me, too.
Okay. Thank you.
Bernadette: Well, I need a little help. I accidentally destroyed one of Howard’s comic books this morning, and was hoping I could replace it.
Batman got his ass kicked by my curling iron.
Ooh, I was kind of hoping to get it before Howie comes home from work.
Well, he’s always saying I should be more careful with my curling iron, and it seems like a dangerous precedent to let him think he can be right.
You know, I do work at a pharmaceutical company. If you can make this happen today, I can hook you up with anxiety medication, antidepressants.
Oh, that’s terrible. What’s the address?
Oh, thanks, but I don’twant you to close up. I mean, won’t you lose business? Sorry. That was mean.
I don’t think I like the way you’re treating my friend.
Not from you. Let’s go, Stuart.
Yes, I am, there’s a few more things I want to say to you. Stuart’s store is just fine, and he’s a much nicer person than you are, and if you still have that comic, I’d like to buy it right now.
No, I don’t want a latte. I want a cappuccino and a blueberry scone.
Stuart: Yes, but at this point, pretty much any customer does. What can I do for you?
Well, don’t let The Riddler know that. It’s a comic book joke. Or maybe it’s not.
Uh, well, it’s, it’s pretty rare. Can you give me a few days to track it down?
Well, I’ll do what I can, but I can’t make any promises.
Really? Do you have any of these?
No, it’s not. I hate that place. Guy who owns it is a jerk. He’s always making me feel bad about myself.
You know, why don’t I just take you there? That way, I can make sure he doesn’t rip you off.
Yeah. Haven’t seen this many people in my store since that Korean church bus crashed through my front window.
My hair’s exactly the same colour as always.
Look, uh, my friend here needs a comic book.
You know something, Jesse? You may have a successful business and the kind of pink complexion that comes with good nutrition, but I have something more important.
Friendship. Which I would trade in a heartbeat for all of this.
Amy: Hello, Mr. Rat Brain. Not so bitey without the rest of the rat to back us up now, are we?
Hey, what brings you guys here?
Why? Because Sheldon’s not here this week, and you don’t think I have any other options? I’m just kidding. I’ll get my purse.
That’s okay. Uh, Bert, this is Howard and Rajesh. Guys, this is Bert.
This is so pretty. Bert works for the geology department.
Oh, you forgot your quartz.
He’s nice.
What?! No, he doesn’t.
So? He does that every day. Oh.
He’s not my boyfriend.
Should someone as lonely as you really be making fun of me?
What do I do? I don’t want to hurt his feelings.
I guess it hasn’t come up.
I’m sorry. Who are you dating?
Penny really quit The Cheesecake Factory?
That’s nice.
Hello, Bert.
Listen, um, Bert, before you say anything else, I, I have a boyfriend.
Weren’t you?
That’s very nice of you, but I do have a boyfriend.
No, that’s not true. My boyfriend has an off-putting personality, too. Like, way worse than you.
Don’t say that.
No, Bert, come on. I’d love to go to the mineral show with you.
No, it’s not.
So what am I supposed to do now?
This isn’t funny. I’m gonna have to tell him the truth, that even if I didn’t have a boyfriend, I wouldn’t be interested in him.
Well, how would you want a girl to tell you she wasn’t interested?
Okay, I don’t have time for this. I’m just gonna go find him and be brutally honest.
Really? You would do that?
Thank you.
Howard: Anybody home?
Hi.
You’re both into rock?
Yeah, he’s nice because he likes you.
You know, if you’d rather skip lunch and hang out with your boyfriend Bert, it’s totally okay.
Maybe the problem is he thinks you’re available. Does he know you’re dating Sheldon?
There you go.
So, what is she doing today?
The mineral and rock show? That would be awful even without Bert.
Oh, I’ve heard those words so many times. From Linda Nosenchuck, Tammy Rosenworcel.
Marci Grossman, Lisa Mazzarino.
Tammy Cho.
Arlene Russel.
Poor Bert. That guy’s got a rough afternoon ahead of him.
That’s how you reject a guy.
No, don’t.
You want us to talk to him?
Let’s go.
Of course we tell him she’s a lesbian.
Really, really sorry.
Raj: Well, we were just on our way to lunch and wanted to see if you’d like to join.
He brought you a pretty rock.
Are you sure? He’s tall, pale and awkward. That sounds like your type.
And does Sheldon know you’re dating Sheldon?
Prepare your uterus for his gigantic offspring?
Oh, who was that girl from our Starbucks?
Yes. Arlene. She wrote no way on both our cappuccinos.
I guess, uh, I’d like her to sit me down, look me in the eye and say, I was wrong. I love you. And then maybe she could touch me in a special way.
He’ll be so upset. He’ll probably climb up the Empire State Building and start swatting at planes.
Sure. We’ve both been in his shoes. We’ll let him down with compassion and respect.
So we tell him she’s a lesbian, right?
We’re sorry Amy didn’t want to go.
Bert: Hi, Amy. I, oh, I’m sorry. I didn’t know you had any company.
Anyway, I wanted to show you this tourmalinated quartzthat we got in the lab.
Yeah. You know what, uh, geologists and Bon Jovi have in common?
Oh, it’s okay. I want you to have it. Bye.
So, anyway, there’s this big, uh, rock and mineral show next week in Santa Monica.
Oh. This is awkward. You thought I was gonna ask you to go with me to the mineral show.
That’s what you all say. You just don’t want to go out with me because I have an off-putting personality.
Don’t worry. I’m used to it. I mean, I’m big and weird and funny-looking and no one ever wants to do anything with me.
It’s okay. I know I’m a monster.
Thanks for coming to the mineral and rock show with me.
Eh. Who needs her when I have you guys? Rock show! Rock show! Rock show! Rock show! Rock show! Rock show! Rock sho-o-o-o-o-ow!
Stuart (on phone): All right, thanks a lot. They have one at Capital Comics.
Voice: Before we begin your guided meditation, close your eyes and picture yourself in a peaceful environment.
Now, take a deep, relaxing breath in through your nose. And let it out.
Jesse: Haven’t seen you in forever. Look how grey you’ve gotten.
No, I was talking about your skin.
Ooh, and she went into your store by mistake. Good thing there was no one there to see you. What do you need? Oh, yeah, yeah. I got this. Right over here.
Can I offer you a coffee? Espresso? Latte?
How about you, Stu? Mocha? Scone? Directions to the nearest soup kitchen?
I’m just kidding. He knows where the soup kitchen is.
Sorry. You want the book or not?
No problem. Oh, you want a latte while you wait?

I’m willing to if you guys are.

He does that to me, too. Why do we put up with it?

Well, it’s scary for me, too.
